description.narrative: Centralized batch chlorination is the most widely used method of water treatment disinfection during emergencies. Water treatment guidelines stipulate what free residual chlorine (FRC) levels should be at water distribution points in refugee camps to protect water against microbiological contamination. However, previous studies showed these guidelines fail to ensure adequate FRC levels at thepoint-of-consumption, which is necessary for preventing microbiological contamination of stored water. In response, the Safe Water Optimization Tool (SWOT) was developed. This tool is a web-based platform where field workers can upload water quality data to generate site-specific, evidence-based point-of-consumption FRC targets that maximizes the proportion of waterusers having safe water at the point-of-consumption. This works aims to gather evidence on the SWOT effectiveness and on previously identified concerns around SWOT use, including data input requirements, user functionalities, chlorine taste/odor thresholds, and disinfection by-products. To do so, the Research Team will conduct a mixed-methods approach in three-to-be-determined evaluation sites in humanitarian contexts, including water quality testing, surveys, focus group discussions, and interviews. Collecting these evidences will benefit operational agencies, affected populations, and donors by developing generalizable tools and processes for improving program quality, community engagement and accountability, and public health risk reduction.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.
